content: use a thicker weight yarn along with larger needle sizes to make a larger decoration if you prefer e x t r a t i p s i hope you enjoy using this pattern i have written up some extra tips about knitting and finishing so please pop by for a visit and check out the knitting tips section on https //littlecottonrabbits com/ if you get stuck with any aspect of the pattern please come and visit the little cotton rabbit group on ravelry https //www ravelry com/groups/little-cotton-rabbits or the little cotton rabbits facebook group https //www facebook com/groups/littlecottonrabbits lots of knitters who ve already used my patterns hang out there and one of us will do our best to help you you ll also find lots of other projects made from these patterns please come and share yours u l i e w i l l i a m s l i t t l e c o t t o n r a b b i t s page 2 t h e p a t t e r n i n s t r u c t i o n s fig 1 fig 2 fig 3 b o d y a n d h e a d knitted in one piece using 2 25mm us 1 needles cable cast on 20 stitches with yarn a row 1 right side knit row 2 knit row 3 k2 join in yarn b and k1 k1 9 times cut yarn b from the work leaving a short tail for weaving in row 4 purl row 5-10 beginning with a knit row and ending with a purl row work 6 row of stocking stitch cut yarn a from the work leaving a long tail for seaming the body section with later row 11-18 change to yarn c beginning with a knit row and ending with a purl work 8 row of stocking stitch cut yarn c from the work leaving a long tail for seaming the head section with later now you ve finished knitting the head and body fig 1 next thread the tapestry needle with an 8 inch long length of strong yarn one that will not break and sew this through the 20 stitches on the needle slip them off as you go and leave the tail ends of this thread loose for now take the second length of the strong yarn and sew through the loops from the back of the topmost row of red knitting fig 2 again leaving this loose for now next take your small circle of felt and place at the back of the work behind where you plan to embroider the face using black yarn embroider a small nose in centre of face - i use one
